Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Connect 4 Board Class All methods required to manipulate the board are found here.
    Version:
    Dec 2, 2025
    Author:
    Nick Stoyanov

      No argument constructor for Board class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        No argument constructor for Board class. Only clears the board.

    • Method Detail

      • getEmptyCells

        public int getEmptyCells()
        Accessor method to get the number of empty cells on the board.
        Returns:
        number of empty cells on the board

      • getBoard

        public char[][] getBoard()
        Accessor method to get the current board state.
        Returns:
        2D char array representing the board

      • getWinner

        public java.lang.String getWinner()
        Method to check for a winner on the board. It scans the board for 4 in a row.
        Returns:
        "●" if player wins, "○" if AI wins, null if no winner yet.

      • clearBoard

        public void clearBoard()
        Method to clear the board. Resets all cells to empty and resets empty cell count.

      • isColumnFull

        public boolean isColumnFull(int col)
        Method to check if a column is full.
        Parameters:
        col - column to check
        Returns:
        true if column is full, false otherwise

      • placeCell

        public void placeCell(int col,
                      char piece)
        Method to place a piece in a specified column.
        Parameters:
        col - column to place piece in
        piece - character representing the piece to place

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Method to print the current state of the board.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of the board
